channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Aid efforts struggle to bring relief to parts of hurricane-stricken Jamaica
item.description: KINGSTON, Jamaica (AP) — Rescuers and aid workers fanned out across Jamaica on Saturday to distribute food and water and reach communities still isolated four days after Hurricane Melissa hit the island. Essential relief supplies are now rolling into hurricane-stricken St.
item.dc:creator: JOHN MYERS, JR., Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The Paris prosecutor said Saturday two new suspects were handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum, three days after they were arrested by police as part of the sweeping investigation.
item.dc:creator: SYLVIE CORBET, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: The Paris prosecutor says two new suspects have been handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum.
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Corbet, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces hit an important fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, Ukraine's military intelligence said Saturday, as Russia kept up a sustained campaign of massive drone and missile attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: With pharaoh-fanfare, Egypt unveils a huge new museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: Egypt has inaugurated the Grand Egyptian Museum, the world's largest museum dedicated to a single ancient civilization and an effort aimed at boosting the country's tourism industry and troubled economy.
item.dc:creator: By Samy Magdy, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Tanzania's President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote
item.description: Tanzania's President Samia Suluhu Hassan has won a disputed election with over 97% of the vote, according to official results announced on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, The Hill

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Hundreds of protesters on Friday marched through one of the favelas targeted in Rio de Janeiro's most lethal police raid that left more than 100 dead, calling for Rio state Gov. Cláudio Castro to resign amid continued outrage over the deadly operation.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Pakistan says it seeks no further escalation but urges Afghanistan to act against militants
item.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan does not seek further escalation of hostilities with Afghanistan but expects the South Asian country's Taliban rulers to address its security concerns by taking action against militants operating from Afghan soil, Pakistan’s Foreign Ministry said Friday.
item.dc:creator: MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Royal prerogative: King Charles III banishes Andrew to buttress the House of Windsor's foundations
item.description: No one is bigger than the monarchy. Not even the king’s brother. In the end, that reality spelled the end of Andrew’s life as a prince of the realm.
item.dc:creator: DANICA KIRKA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: Aid teams flock to Jamaica to help with Hurricane Melissa recovery
item.description: David Archer, deputy governor of the British Virgin Islands, told NewsNation he's seen many organizations eager to help.
item.dc:creator: Anna Kutz, NewsNation

item.title: Built in the shadows and launched at night, Ukraine's long-range drones are rattling Russia
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — At a secret location in rural Ukraine, columns of attack drones are assembled at night and in near silence to strike deep inside Russia. Their targets are strategic: oil refineries, fuel depots, and military logistics hubs.
item.dc:creator: DEREK GATOPOULOS and VOLODYMYR YURCHUK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: China's Xi promises to protect free trade at APEC as Trump snubs major summit
item.description: GYEONGJU, South Korea (AP) — Chinese leader Xi Jinping told Asia-Pacific leaders on Friday that his country would help to defend global free trade at an annual economic regional forum snubbed by U.S. President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, KIM TONG-HYUNG and HUIZHONG WU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ex-Mossad chief behind Iran nuclear warehouse raid says Iran’s atomic sites ‘obliterated,’ credits Trump
item.description: Former Mossad director reveals Iran's nuclear sites were "obliterated" in U.S. strikes, warns Tehran that Israel "can come again" if uranium enrichment resumes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Rio favelas left reeling after lethal gang raid as families bury the dead
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Families of the scores of people killed in a deadly gang raid by Rio de Janeiro police began burying the dead on Thursday, with residents left reeling by the scenes of carnage and livid at law enforcement whom they accuse of excessive force, torture and extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Serbia youth lead thousands on march for weekend rally marking deadly canopy collapse last year
item.description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Thousands of mainly young people in Serbia embarked on a two-day march from Belgrade on Thursday, aiming to join a major rally in the country's north this weekend that will mark the anniversary of a deadly train station disaster.
item.dc:creator: JOVANA GEC, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ultra-Orthodox protesters in Jerusalem rally over Israel’s draft exemption as clashes break out
item.description: Ultra-Orthodox protesters flooded Jerusalem to oppose military draft requirements, adding further pressure on the government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Red Cross receives two coffins of deceased hostages in Gaza Strip, IDF says
item.description: Israel said the Red Cross reported receiving "two coffins of deceased hostages" during a transfer in the Gaza Strip and is brining the remains to IDF troops.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WGN 9

item.title: Hegseth announces new strike on alleged narco-trafficking boat, killing 4
item.description: The military campaign comes as the U.S. has turned up pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, NewsNation

item.title: 5 more arrests made in Louvre jewel heist
item.description: It took thieves less than eight minutes to steal the jewels valued at $102 million. The treasures remain missing.
item.dc:creator: ANGELA CHARLTON and THOMAS ADAMSON, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: Stunned residents wandered about, some staring at their roofless homes and waterlogged belongings strewn around them.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — Hurricane Melissa left at least dozens dead and caused widespread destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica, where roofless homes, toppled utility poles and water-logged furniture dominated the landscape Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR. and EVENS SANON, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump cuts China tariff after Xi signals tougher fentanyl enforcement, rare-earth pause
item.description: Trump announced a cut on Chinese imports after meeting with Xi in South Korea, citing new understandings on fentanyl enforcement, farm trade and rare-earth exports.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Frontlines with Robert Sherman: All eyes on China, US relationship
item.description: The two heads of state representing the two most powerful economies in the world are set to meet face-to-face within the next few hours.
item.dc:creator: Robert Sherman, NewsNation

item.title: 80-year-old Australian woman dies on island after cruise ship leaves without her
item.description: An 80-year-old Australian woman was found dead after the Coral Adventurer cruise ship allegedly left her behind on Lizard Island during a hiking tour.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Putin says Russia's nuclear-armed underwater drone was tested successfully
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia has conducted a successful test of a new atomic-powered and nuclear-capable underwater drone, President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday, declaring that the new weapon can't be intercepted.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Putin hails successful test of nuclear-powered underwater torpedo
item.description: Putin announced successful Poseidon nuclear drone testing as President Donald Trump urged Russia to end the Ukraine war instead of testing missiles on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: No date to let Mexican cattle into US as work on sterile flies continues
item.description: Mexican Agriculture Minister Julio Berdegue said on Wednesday that Mexico and the United States have not yet set a date to resume Mexican cattle exports amid an outbreak of the flesh-eating screwworm parasite.
item.dc:creator: NewsNation

item.title: South Korea, US advance talks of $350B trade deal
item.description: President Trump said a deal with South Korea was "pretty much finalized," though neither government has signed an official agreement.
item.dc:creator: Libbey Dean, NewsNation

item.title: US sending strike boats to Venezuela for 'shock and awe' effect: Senator
item.description: "I think maybe the president is sending a message that, look, we're serious about it," Sen. Mike Rounds told "On Balance.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation

item.title: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa brings flooding and catastrophic winds to Jamaica
item.description: KINGSTON, Jamaica (AP) — Heavy floodwaters swept across southwestern Jamaica, winds tore roofs off buildings and boulders tumbled onto roads Tuesday as Hurricane Melissa pummeled the Caribbean island as a catastrophic Category 5 storm, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes on record.
item.dc:creator: DÁNICA COTO and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Photos as Hurricane Melissa makes landfall as Category 5 storm
item.description: "Don't bet against Melissa because you will lose," warned Jamaican Government Minister Desmond McKenzie.
item.dc:creator: Sean Noone, NewsNation
